content.question: A ball of mass <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> swings in a horizontal circle at the end of a string of radius <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at a constant tangential speed <math alttext="v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. A student gradually pulls the string inward such that the radius of the circle decreases while keeping the tangential speed <math alttext="v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> of the ball constant, as shown above. Which of the following graphs best represents the acceleration <math alttext="a" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the ball as a function of time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: The figure presents a graph with horizontal axis labeled “t,” and vertical axis  labeled “a.” A line begins close to the top of the vertical axis and moves to the right, parallel with the horizontal axis.

The figure presents a graph with horizontal axis labeled “t,” and vertical axis labeled “a.” A line begins slightly up the vertical axis and moves gradually upward and to the right until approximately three quarters of the way across the horizontal axis, where it steeply curves upward and to the right, ending near the top of the vertical axis.

The figure presents a graph with horizontal axis labeled “t,” and vertical axis labeled “a.” A line begins at the top of the vertical axis and moves steeply downward and to the right until approximately one quarter of the way across the horizontal axis, where it curves gradually downward and to the right, ending slightly above the horizontal axis.

The figure presents a graph with horizontal axis labeled “t,” and vertical axis labeled “a.” The curve begins near the top of the vertical axis and curves downward and to the right until it ends near the rightmost point on the horizontal axis.

content.answer: The figure presents a graph with horizontal axis labeled “t,” and vertical axis labeled “a.” A line begins slightly up the vertical axis and moves gradually upward and to the right until approximately three quarters of the way across the horizontal axis, where it steeply curves upward and to the right, ending near the top of the vertical axis.
